Class SU

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--SU
class SU
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a set of string replacement functions to process all the parameter and variable replacements in node generation.

replaceHrefs

static java.lang.String replaceHrefs(java.lang.String s)
For each hypertext link to a Lazy node, replace the u parameter values by "safe" values i.e. values that are corretly transported by URLs. Replace all occurences of by i.e. replace all href parameters with a safe encoding

getParameters

static java.lang.String getParameters(java.lang.String s)
Replace &u=__X1__&u=__X2__;... by &u=__encode__(__X1__)&u=__encode__(__X2__);...

replaceParameters

static java.lang.String replaceParameters(java.lang.String s,
                                          java.lang.String[] params)
REPLACE PARAMETERS replace every occurence of "<> by '__the value of paramenter number NUM with quotes doubled__' TODO: replace numeric or unquoted parameters (unquoted) marked as <>

replaceSystemParameters

static java.lang.String replaceSystemParameters(java.lang.String s,
                                                javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                                java.util.Hashtable text,
                                                java.lang.String projectid)
Replace variable markers by the variable values. There are two styles of variable markers old form = [[__VARIABLE_NAME__]] new form = <<[??var-__VARIABLE_NAME__??]>> The different types of variables are ?NAME language dependent variable, defined either for this project or shared by all projects (SHARE) !NAME old style : do nothing, it's for parameters; new style : same as session attribute NAME : session attribute

replaceQueryParameters

static void replaceQueryParameters(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                   java.lang.String[] u)
Replace variable markers in node parameters by their actual values => restriction: a node paramter must not contain the string <<[??ivar-
